metadata.Title: CVE-2023-2454 on Ubuntu 22.04 LTS (jammy) - medium.
metadata.Description:
schema_element defeats protective search_path changes; It was found that certain database calls in PostgreSQL could permit an authed attacker with elevated database-level privileges to execute arbitrary code.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2023-2454` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

libecpg-compat3 - 14.8-0ubuntu0.22.04.1
libecpg6 - 14.8-0ubuntu0.22.04.1
libpgtypes3 - 14.8-0ubuntu0.22.04.1
libpq5 - 14.8-0ubuntu0.22.04.1
postgresql-14 - 14.8-0ubuntu0.22.04.1
postgresql-client-14 - 14.8-0ubuntu0.22.04.1
postgresql-plperl-14 - 14.8-0ubuntu0.22.04.1
postgresql-plpython3-14 - 14.8-0ubuntu0.22.04.1
postgresql-pltcl-14 - 14.8-0ubuntu0.22.04.1
No subscription required

notes.Note: leosilva> PostgreSQL 9.3 is end of life upstream, and no updates are are available. Marking as deferred in -esm-main releases. PostgreSQL 9.3 is end of life upstream, and no updates are are available. Marking as deferred in -esm-main releases.

criterions.comment: postgresql-14 package in jammy was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '14.8-0ubuntu0.22.04.1').
